search.slidetext: 08 clinical incidents: wsib and non-wsib reporting – interaction example for tess 2019

needle a needle, ampule or pill cutter are sources for reportable injury or exposure. clean needle pokes are reportable. close a patient’s body fluids are a source of reportable exposure. confused and agitated patients can cause reportable injury by hitting the care provider. patient close a sharps container can be a source for reportable injury and exposure sharps container close improper maneuvering of iv poles can result in a reportable injury (e.g. wheels rolling over toes, pole tipping over). iv pole placement close equipment cables and wires can be a source for reportable injury. equipment cables close an open cupboard door can be a source for reportable injury open cupboard close puddles or objects on the floor can be a source for reportable injury/exposure. falls due to student becoming lightheaded/fainting can also occur and are a reportable injury. messy floor close view 7 sources of potential injury or exposure in this room?

try again try again try again try again try again try again that is incorrect. please try again. incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue you did not select the correct response. incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue that's right! you selected the correct response. correct 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 student obtains assessment documentation student and ci complete 4 time sensitive forms submit placement site incident report assessment by occupational health dept ci notifies clinical coordinator & pppdo* submit completed wsib forms to pppdo submit lsbfon online clinical incident form ci notified of injury put clinical incident procedure steps in order – . drag and drop each step into the correct order. access the policy at any time in the resources area located at the top right of the screen. knowledge check - clinical incidents reporting process 8
